lines.text: They can't buy food. They came here stripped of everything. All the way from Rangoon. Can you imagine what it must have been like? Hundreds of miles. I don't know how any of them got through alive.
It's for you. You have no one to give it to?
I'm glad because now you can keep it for me.
After that, I didn't want to go on living. You'd think that would be easy enough in war but it didn't work. I wanted to die but I got medals instead.
It's not good to die inside.
It's like living a bad dream.
Here we bury the dead in the earth not in our hearts. Is the dream over now?
